content: readme.md pairingmatrix to read matrix?1. matrix is purely based commits.2. darker line more pair has worked together.3. you a dark red circle around name means person has worked aloneinstallationadd line your application's gemfile:gem 'pairing_matrix' then execute:$ bundle install yourself :$ gem install pairing_matrixusage of you need decide format your commit messages e.g.#feature [dev1/dev2] commit message can choose format long you are able extract dev names the message using regex.once have decided the commit message format, create pairing_matrix.yml file.authors_regex: ^.*\[([\w]*)(?:\/)?([\w]*)\].*$github_access_token: 000324cff69wes5613f732c345hn679c0knt509cgithub_repos: - org1/repo1 - org1/repo2 - github_username/my_private_repoauthors_regex: regex is used extract dev names the commit message. can verify regex irb console using below command. your regex is correct will return array dev names.e.g"#4324 [ajit/abhishek] commit message".scan(/^.*\[([\w]*)(?:\/)?([\w]*)\].*$/).flatten=> ["ajit", "abhishek"]github_access_token: you to private github repos matrix, create github_access_token give the repo read permission. here is you create token: https://help.github.com/articles/creating--personal-access-token--the-command-line/github_repos:list repos you to for matrix. you your repos inside organization follow org/repo format else mention github_username/repo. after installing pairing matrix gem, simply run pairing_matrix command the repo where have pairing_matrix.yml file. command start web server. hit url localhost:4567/matrix the browser. example pairing_matrix.ymlhere is sample pairing_matrix.yml fileauthors_regex: ^.*\[([\w]*)(?:\/)?([\w]*)\].*$repos: - /users/ajit/projects/project1 - /users/ajit/projects/project2 - /users/ajit/projects/project3 above config fetch data directly your local repositories. to fetch private repos data directly github?authors_regex: ^.*\[([\w]*)(?:\/)?([\w]*)\].*$github_access_token: 000324cff69wes5613f732c345hn679c0knt509cgithub_repos: -
